channel.title: Community on Dwarves Foundation
channel.description: Recent content in Community on Dwarves Foundation

item.title: How to transfer $DFG from Ethereum Mainnet to Base Network for staking
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: This guide will show you how to use $DFG staking to earn $USDC, cool merch, and more. You’ll need a computer with a browser.

item.title: #2 Walk Around Learn Around
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: There are so many amazingly fun and wonderfully weird things happening on Discord, both last week and of course, today. So let’s dive in with a freshly-brewed “cà phê sữa,” of course.

item.title: #1 What Do You Stand For?
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Lock in Your Workspace. Show the World. Our Discord crew is buzzing with energy after our last Friday community call, with folks sharing snapshots of their workspaces.

item.title: Design less, present more with Deckset
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Do you ever feel overwhelmed by the myriad of design tools and options in PowerPoint, or the countless books and tutorials dedicated to beautifying a single sentence on a 100-inch screen?

item.title: Design less, present more with Deckset
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Do you ever feel overwhelmed by the myriad of design tools and options in PowerPoint, or the countless books and tutorials dedicated to beautifying a single sentence on a 100-inch screen?

item.title: Level Up Your Markdown Memos: Avoiding Common Pitfalls
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Markdown uses symbols and stuff to make your text look fancy. It’s like learning a new skill, game, or design program - there will be bumps in the road before you’re a pro.

item.title: What's New in March 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Reporting tech signals: everything new on artificial intelligence, API techniques, toolings, programming languages, and the intersection of design and engineering.

item.title: How To Take Better Screenshots On Mac
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I grab screenshots pretty often. Although macOS’s native screenshot tool is decent for most cases, it’s still a very basic one.

item.title: Starting your journey at Dwarves Discord
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Welcome to Dwarves Network, We’ve grown a lot since launching our Discord server since the first day we made this network grow based on developers-centric.

item.title: What's New in January 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before you dive in Dwarves is operated as a 50% company, 50% community. Everything we learn along the way of work, we transform into knowledge and distribute back to our tech community.

item.title: Dwarves Community
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Dwarves Community is melting pot for software engineers, thinkers, learners and techies who are to explore, learn and master the latest advancements in technology.

item.title: $icy in 2024
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Follow up on our recent post df protocol, $icy and $dfg. Since 2020, $icy has been a part of our workflow.

item.title: What's New in October 2023
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: Before you dive in Dwarves is operated as a 50% company, 50% community. Everything we learn along the way of work, we transform into knowledge and distribute back to our tech community.

item.title: Community Bounty
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: As you may know, Dwarves Discord network is where we connect with our friends, alumni, and like-minded people. Bounties are rewards (in ICY - Dwarves’ token) given out to community members for work that encourages community developers to get more involved in the development outside of their core skills.

item.title: Working On A Project Interview Assessment At Dwarves
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: I had my fair share of interviews. Most of them are “traditional” QnA sessions, and unpaid take-home projects, and coding assessments.

item.title: Discord Roles
item.author: han@d.foundation (Han Ngo)
item.description: To organize our discord and make it fun to interact between community members, we setup those roles for specific purposes. They are ladder-based and function-based roles.
